# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

# Answer

Here is a possible implementation of the function `timezone_bumper(dt, bump)`:

```julia
function timezone_bumper(dt::Date, bump::Int)
    if bump > 0 # Allow positive bumps only
        throw(Error("Function can only handle dates with UTC offset"))
    else
        throw(Error("Invalid argument type"))
    end
end

function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime, bump::Int)
    if bump == 0 # Handle no bump
        return dt
    elseif bump > 0 # Increase the timestamp by bump hours
        return add(dt, Dates.Hour(bump))
    elseif bump < 0 # Decrease the timestamp by -bump hours
        return add(dt, -Dates.Hour(abs(bump)))
    else
        throw(Error("Invalid argument type"))
    end
end
```

This function checks if the input is a valid DateTime type and applies the bump hours accordingly. It throws an error for Date types or negative bumps.
